description: Triangle read by rows in which row n lists the primitive roots mod n (omitting numbers n without a primitive root).
links: T. D. Noe, First 100 rows of triangle, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Primitive Root.
mathematica: a[n_] := Select[Range[n-1], GCD[#, n] == 1 && MultiplicativeOrder[#, n] == EulerPhi[n]& ]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 30}] // Flatten (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Oct 23 2012 *)
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
